alert.note: Alert for Fergus; Judith Basin (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued March 07 at 8:30PM MST until March 07 at 9:00PM MST by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: The National Weather Service in Great Falls has issued a * Snow Squall Warning for... Southeastern Judith Basin County in central Montana... South central Fergus County in central Montana... * Until 900 PM MST. * At 828 PM MST, a dangerous snow squall was located along a line extending from 10 miles southeast of Lewistown to 6 miles south of Hobson, moving southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Poor visibility in snow and blowing snow. Wind gusts greater than 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Variable visibility down to a quarter mile or less and slippery roads could result in hazardous driving conditions. * This includes the following highways... Highway 200 between mile markers 61 and 89. Highway 191 between mile markers 1 and 2, and between mile markers 1 and 2. Locations impacted include... Lewistown, Moore, Glengarry, Buffalo and Garneill. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Wet roadways will quickly freeze. Black ice will cause roads, bridges and overpasses to become slick and dangerous. Slow down and be prepared for sudden loss of traction.
